patterns: What CGPA do I need to be in good academic standing?
What CPGA do I need to have a clear academic standing?
What do I need to have a good academic standing?
Standing
Academic Standing
What do i need to get a clear standing
What do i need to get a clear academic standing
GPA
CGPA
TGPA
responses: Effective Fall 2021, in order to maintain a CLEAR standing, as per the 2022-2023 Undergraduate Calendar for Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering Co-Op, Civil Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering, a CGPA of 1.67 (or higher) AND TGPA of 1.33 (or higher) will be required. Students taking courses under a Probation Contract will need to adhere to the specific CGPA and TGPA requirements as per their contract. For more information, visit the Undergraduate Calendar for the specific program, admittance year and refer to Academic Standing Variation and Grades, GPA and Academic Standing.

patterns: ACR Medical
I missed a test/exam because of my health
What do I do if I miss a test because I'm unwell?
What if I miss an exam because I am sick?
What to do if I'm sick and can't write an exam/test?
what to do if i am sick and can't write my exam
What do I do if I missed class for a medical reason?
What do I do if I missed class for a medical reason?
I need medical consideration
Medical Consideration
What if I am sick for class?
Sick
Absent from illness
Academic consideration for illness
How do I get academic consideration for illness
Do I need a doctors note?
responses: Please ensure your notify your professor(s) of your situation, as this is always the first step. Toronto Metropolitan University does have a process for Academic Consideration Requests (ACR), when students experience extenuating circumstances that have a significant impact on their ability to fulfill an academic requirement. In order to submit an ACR as per TMU Policy guidelines, students must complete Part 1 of the TMU Student Health Certificate and have a Health Professional complete Part 2 of the form, including the clinic's official stamp. Once the TMU Student Health Certificate is fully completed, the next step is to submit the ACR through the Online Academic Consideration Request portal attaching the TMU Student Health Certificate. This must be done within three (3) business days of the missed obligation. If the submission is able to be verified by the FYEO, you will then follow-up with your instructor regarding the next steps and arrangements for the make-up.

patterns: How can I access advising support?
How can I access support?
How can I get advising?
How can I get advising support?
How can I get support?
responses: The FYEO provides drop-in, live, on-the-spot advising through the Virtual Advising Room, external link. Our Student Advising Team is available to answer questions about your first-year courses, liberals, minors, enrollment, deadline dates, or anything else, and can get you connected to other departments across campus for further support. Stop by any time, Monday – Friday, 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM through Zoom with meeting code: 805-334-1745. You can always email the FYEO at firstyeareng@ryerson.ca. All email inquiries will be answered within 48 working hours, however, during peak times the response time may be longer. Please include your name and student number when contacting us.

patterns: Can I appeal my final Grade or Standing?
Appeal
Appeal Grades
Can I appeal my standing
How do i appeal my grades or standing
How do students submit appeals?
responses: Students can submit a Grade or Standing Appeal if it falls under one of the grounds for appeal identified in the TMU Academic Consideration Policy 167. Once final grades are posted on RAMMS you can submit an appeal, if you believe you have grounds. Here is the link to the TMU Senate Appeals portal. Note: there are deadlines for Grade Appeals and Standing Appeals at the end of each semester listed on the Significant Dates Calendar. Students are encouraged to contact the Academic Advocacy at the TMU Students’ Union who provide students with workshops, information and advising on appeals. The TMU Ombudsperson also has resources regarding appeals on their website.

responses: Your audio and video settings will be evaluated as you enter the session. Click “ok” if your audio and camera are working in the test. Note: Your browser may ask you to allow it to use the computer’s camera and audio. Please allow it.

responses: Toronto Metropolitan University allows students and instructors 10 minutes to get to the class. If a class is scheduled for 10:00 AM, the professor will begin at 10:10 AM, unless otherwise specified in class.

Can I make changes to my class schedule?
responses: Your schedule will be made for you at the beginning of the semester, provided that you completed your course intentions. You can make changes to your schedule during your enrolment period. To make schedule changes, students may do so on RAMSS (Ryerson Administrative Management Self Serivce) or VSB (Visual Schedule builder). Students who were admitted late will need to create their own timetable. Visit the RAMSS Support page for step-by-step instructions. For more general information about your first-year timetable, please refer to the Undergraduate Student Guide.

patterns: How can I JOIN CLUBS?

clubs?
student groups
responses: The Metropolitan University Student Engineering Society has various clubs and events which you might find interesting. You can check out their website or contact them directly for more information. The TMU Students' Union (RSU) also has various student clubs, including some for Engineering which you can also check out on their website. You can also refer to the TMU events page for any other events. Just be sure to scroll down to the bottom of the page and click on the "Load More" button so it keeps bringing up all the events as not everything will appear on one screen.

responses: At the Faculty of Engineering and Architectural Science (FEAS), all nine of our undergraduate programs offer paid, full-time co-operative internship opportunities. For more information on how to apply for the Co-op program, please refer to the Co-operative Internships page.

You may contact the Centre for Student Development and Counselling through phone (416-979-5195) or email (csdc@ryerson.ca) and ask to set up an appointment with one of our engineering counsellors. 24/7 support can also be accessed through keep.meSAFE at 1-844-451-9700 or through the app found on the Apple Store and Google Play.

patterns: What is enrollment for?
What is enrollment?
What does enrollment mean ?
What is course enrollment for?
responses: Enrollment is the process of selecting your courses for the academic year and adding them to RAMSS. During the course enrollment period, you can adjust your course schedule by adding, dropping or swapping classes. All incoming engineering students have the same first-year courses. Please check the undergraduate calendar for your year of admittance. Please check to make sure you are enrolled in these courses. In addition to your 5 engineering course, you have to take 1 lower-level liberal course from Table A. The FYEO does not encourage students to take their Table A in the 1st semester, the two Table A's, one Table B and one Table B from the short list, can be completed anytime before graduation and students may want to consider taking them over a Spring/Summer semester. You can review Table A and decide on what course interests you. From here, please refer to How to Enrol - RAMSS Support to enroll.

patterns: How do I find my course information?
Where do I find my course information?
Course Information
responses: Once you log in to my.ryerson.ca portal, your course will be listed under “The Online Courses & Organizations” tab on the landing page. Click on your course name to enter the course page and access material.

patterns: What are course intentions?
When do I fill course intentions out?
What do course intentions mean?
What do I have to do for course intentions?
When do I fill them out
responses:
Course intentions is the process where returning students indicate the courses they wish to take in the upcoming academic year via RAMSS. If you are a new student, you will not need to complete this process before the start of your first term.

The course intentions period occurs in March for the upcoming academic year. Course intention changes can be made during the course intention adjustment periods in the spring (May) and fall (August to September).

Course intention appointments are automatically scheduled by Toronto Metropolitan University. As a student, you will be notified through your university email of your upcoming course intention appointment. Course intention appointment information can also be found in the Enrolment Dates section of your Student Centre in RAMSS.

patterns: Where can I find my course materials?
Where do I find my course materials?
Course Materials
responses: Professors often post course outlines, materials and announcements in D2L. The code for each course in which you are enrolled will appear under “My Courses.” If you do not see a course code, contact your professor.

patterns: How can I prepare over the summer for my fall courses?
How can I prepare for my fall courses?
How can I prepare for my fall courses during the summer?
How do I prepare for my fall courses during the summer?
responses: This summer, the First-Year Engineering Office (FYEO) will be offering several optional programs such as the Engineering Boost Program - a series of optional mini courses in math, physics, and programming designed to help you improve and reinforce fundamental topics and concepts you’ll encounter later in your first year engineering subjects. These courses are at no cost to you, and you can choose to register in one or two or all three of them to keep your studies up over the summer. Registration is required. The Pre-Orientation, Orientation, Post-Orientation (Engineering POP) programs are an opportunity to learn more about the social and academic aspects of university, get involved on campus early, meet upper-year leaders and ambassadors (FYA), gain valuable leadership skills, network and meet other students with similar interests before orientation week.

responses: You should direct your questions to your course coordinator with your full name, student ID, and course section (if applicable). The email must have text with complete sentences, correct spelling, and proper grammar. Overall, it should have a professional tone.

patterns: If I fail a class, am I automatically out of good academic standing?
What happens to my standing if I fail a class?
Do I need to pass all of my classes to achieve a clear academic standing?
What happens if I fail a class?
What if I fail a course?
responses: Student's Academic Standing concerns their CGPA and TGPA, so if the CGPA is 1.67 or above and their TGPA is 1.33 and above, they are still in good standing. However, if a student fail a course that is required for your program you will be required to repeat it. If you fail a required course for the third time, you will be assigned an Academic Standing of Permanent Program Withdrawal. For more information, visit the Grades, GPA and Academic Standing website.

patterns: Why can I no longer opt out of some fees, as was the case last year with the Student Choice Initiative?
opt out
responses: On November 21, 2019 the Ontario Divisional Court made the decision to suspend the opt-out process. As a result, students will be assessed both optional and compulsory ancillary fees effective Winter 2020. For additional information please review TorontoMet Today.

patterns: Can I see my final exam?
How can I see my final exam ?
Will i be able to see my final exam
Can I see my exam?
Can I view my exam?
When are my exams?
responses: Fall 2022 final exams period is December 7 – 18, including Saturday and Sunday. The final exam schedule will be posted approximately one month before the final exam period. Your course coordinator will set days and times at the beginning of next semester for exam review. An announcement will be made when the dates are available. Do not contact your instructor requesting to review your exam before then. Final exams may be viewed but they are not returned. For any additional information, please visit the Exams page

responses: For some courses you do not need to pass the final exam in order to pass the course. However, not all courses are like this. You should consult your individual course outlines to see what rules/policies are in place for determination of a passing grade.

responses: As a first-year student, you do not need to register for courses you will be enrolled automatically. Courses for the 1st semester are common to all engineering majors. To learn more about the program courses for your disciple of Engineering, please review the 2022-2023 Undergraduate Engineering Course Calendar.

patterns: What is First Year in Two Years?
First Year in two years
reduced course load
What is the First Year in Two Years Program?
responses: If a student hasn't completed all required first-year core courses in first year, the student will be considered a First-Year-in-Two-Year student. This means that the student will be taking some of their first-year engineering courses they have yet to complete in the following academic year. Students can also opt to be a First-Year-in-Two-Year student by taking advantage of a reduced course load at the beginning of their first year of studies.

responses:
If a student is not able to enrol into a course because the course is full. 
There is a Wait List form set up each semester for all required first year engineering courses being offered. Each semester there are also directions for upper year courses, based on the specific course. Please check with a full-time staff member.

responses: Frosh week is hosted by the Metropolitan Undergraduate Engineering Society (MUES).

intents.tag: Full time vs Part Time - OSAP
patterns: what is full time for osap?
what is full time studies?
how many courses is considered a full time studnet?
how many courses is considered a full time student?
full time vs part time?
full-time vs part-time?
how many courses do I have to take?
responses: For OSAP, to be considered as a full-time student, you must be taking 60% or more of a full course load (three or more courses per term). A student who is enrolled in a post secondary institution and is taking two or fewer courses per term (one course per term for students with a permanent disability). Note: OSAP definition of part-time studies is different from how Ryerson defines part-time studies. Please visit the Mini Dictionary webpage for more information.

responses: The FYEO operates from Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm, unless otherwise posted. The FYEO Drop-in Zoom Virtual Advisement Room, is Open weekdays Monday - Friday from 10am - 12pm EST. Students can always email the FYEO at firstyeareng@ryerson.ca.

patterns: I'm pretty close to passing, should I contact my instructor and ask them to bump my grade?
Can I ask my instructor to bump my grade

Can I bump my grade
Can I round my grade
Can I ask to round my grade
Can I ask my professor to round my grade
Can I ask my instructor to round my grade
Should I ask my instructor to round my grade
Can I boost my grade
responses: The only reason for changing a grade would be a marking issue. First, wait until you see your grade on RAMSS. The instructor may have made some kind of adjustment that resulted in your obtaining a passing grade. Second, instructors have already considered/reviewed the overall grades before sending them to the Registrar and usually will not change their minds once a decision has been made. Grades are based on the merit of the work done in the course.

patterns: What if I received an INC/F-S in a course?

I have a F-S for one of my courses

What does F-S mean?
responses: INC stands for “Incomplete”. This means that you are missing an assessment which is stopping you from receiving a final grade. F-S stands for redeemable failure, where the instructor is giving you the opportunity to write a “redeemable failure exam” For more information, visit the Grades, GPA and Academic Standing website.

responses: All Engineering Students must complete 2 Lower Level Liberals from Table A and 2 Upper Level Liberals, 1 from from Table B and 1 from a short list - listed on the specific calendar.

patterns: Questions about Placement Tests for Languages, Literatures and Cultures Courses
I want to take a language course for a liberal but I need a placement test?

responses: Students interested in taking a Language Course are required to take a Placement Test.Contact the Languages, Literatures and Cultures department for more information.

patterns: Can I take liberals in the spring/summer?
When should I take liberals
When can i take liberals?
liberal studies
What are liberal studies
What are liberal studies courses?
responses:
When do you recommend taking your liberal studies?
This varies for every student. Some students decide to take it in the Fall along with the required 5 (or less courses) and some decide to do them in the spring or in upper years. **We don’t encourage a full course load (of 6 courses) especially with online learning.**
All Engineering students are required to complete four Liberal Studies Courses as per their graduation requirements. You do not have to take your Liberal courses in your first year of study; liberal courses just have to be completed before you apply to graduate. Many students use the Spring/Summer term to complete their liberals or complete them in their later years so they can concentrate more on their Engineering courses, especially in their first year. In total, students must take TWO (2) Table A - Lower Level Liberals, ONE (1) Table B - Upper Level Liberal, and ONE (1) Engineering Upper Level Liberal. 

Please note that first-year engineering midterms are often held on Fridays from 6 p.m. - 8 p.m., so you should ensure that you do not enroll in a Liberal studies course that conflicts with this time.

patterns: How do I get to the live sessions for my course?

responses: Your instructor for each course will let you know. In the D2L course shell; in the navigation pane on the left select the section your instructor has indicated for live sessions. Select the date and time for the appropriate session; click “join session”.

patterns: How can I get a locker?

Where can I get a locker
responses: Please check with a full-time staff member for assistance. Generally, lockers are issued to first-year students in the first week of class during the Fall semester. Due to a limited number of lockers, these can only be issued on a first-come, first-serve basis. An email is issued to all first-year students in the first week of classes with further instructions.

patterns: Why am I having difficulty logging in?
I am having issues logging in?
Why do I have login issues
responses: Verify you are using the latest versions of Google Chrome or Firefox. Next, ensure you are using your TorontoMet username and password to log in. If you’re still having trouble logging in, contact the CCS Help Desk at help@ryerson.ca

patterns: What if I have less than 1.67?
What if I have less than 1.33?
What do I do if my CGPA is really low?
I have a low cgpa. Does this affect my standing?
What do I do to maintain a clear academic standing?
What if my cgpa is below a 1.67?
What if my tgpa is below a 1.33
CGPA
TGPA
What if I have a CGPA less than 1.67?
responses: If your CGPA is between 1.00 and 1.66, or if your TGPA is under 1.33 you will recieve a Probationary Standing. If your CGPA is below 1.00, you will be Required to Withdraw (RTW) unless you are a new student to Toronto Metropolitan in your first term (Fall), in this case the student’s standing is set to Probationary. For more information, refer to <a href= "https://www.ryerson.ca/first-year-engineering-office/academic-support/academic-standing/" >Academic Standing.<a/>

patterns: How can I get a minor?
What do I need for a minor?
What does a minor require?
responses: Minors require an additional 6 courses outside of your degree so it is your responsibility to speak to an advisor to manage your coursework accordingly. A list of minors offered can be found here

patterns: I need to miss an exam, lab or quiz. How do I arrange for accomodations?
I need to miss an exam, lab or quiz. What should I do?
I need to miss an exam. What should I do?
I need to miss a quiz. What should I do?
I need to miss a lab. What should I do?
I need to miss something. How do I get accommodations?
What do I do if I miss an exam, test, or quiz?
responses: Submit the Academic Consideration Request through the Senate Online Academic Consideration portal attaching any supporting documents you might have, within 3 business days of your missed obligation. Students must also email their instructor to inform them of your absence, as soon as possible, as this is the first step. Students also have an option of submitting 1 request per term without supporting documentation (some restrictions apply, ie, final exams). For more information, visit the FYEO Meeting Academic Obligations page for details on this process.

patterns: What if I missed class for a non-medical reason?
I missed class for a non-medical reason. What do I do?
responses: Submit the Academic Consideration Request through the Senate Online Academic Consideration portal attaching any supporting documents you might have, within 3 business days of your missed obligation. Students must also email their instructor to inform them of your absence, as soon as possible, as this is the first step. Students also have an option of submitting 1 request per term without supporting documentation (some restrictions apply, ie, final exams). For more information, visit the FYEO Meeting Academic Obligations page for details on this process.

patterns: I have questions about my Offer of Admission. Who can I contact?
How do I contact about my offer of admission?
Who do I talk to about my offer of admission
responses: As an admitted student, we understand that you may have concerns about your Offer of Admission and how you will meet any conditions stated in your offer letter. Connect with your Engineering Admissions team at askeng@ryerson.ca.

patterns: Where do I get my ID?

OneCard?

student card

where can i get my student card?
where can i get my student card
responses: Your Student OneCard is one of the most important tools you’ll need while at Ryerson. Not only is it your official student identification, it also grants you access to campus services and discounts. Once you have applied to a OneCard, you can pick up your OneCard at JOR-02, please approach the Library Building entrance on Nelson Mandela Walk and press the intercom to be connected to staff from Community Safety and Security. Please visit the OneCard Office webpage for more information.

patterns: Do I need to attend orientation?
Should I attention orientation?
responses: Academic orientation, which takes place on the Monday of orientation week, is mandatory for all incoming engineering students. You will be welcomed by your program director, hear from a motivational speaker, tour the campus and write the Writing Skills Test. Additional orientation week and frosh week, external link events are optional but encouraged. To learn more about your first year in engineering, please visit the FYEO website.

responses: The First Year Engineering Office does not deal with finances. Contact the Service Hub for all OSAP/financial assistance questions. Please visit the OSAP webiste or ServiceHub website to get your questions and concerns about OSAP answered.

patterns: Can you take OSMS courses and lower liberal courses at the same time in the Spring/Summer term?
When can I take OSMS courses and lower liberal courses
OSMS
Engineering Specialization
What is an Engineering Specialization program?
What specializations are offered?
Engineering specialization
responses: FEAS offers the Optional Specialization is Management Science (OSMS), a program that provides students with a competitive edge to help them become more marketable upon graduation. Students can take OSMS courses and lower liberal courses at the same time during the Spring/Summer terms. The FYEO strongly encourages that students do not take more than 3 courses in those terms at a time due to the fast- paced nature and heavy course load in the Spring/Summer terms. For more information, refer to the OSMS page.

patterns: How can a student submit a Plan Change Request?

How do I change engineering discipline?
How can a student submit a Plan Changes Request and when is the deadline for the Plan Changes Form?
How do I change engineering programs?
How do I switch engineering programs?
How do I switch programs?
How do I change programs?
responses: Plan Change Requests from one Engineering discipline to another can be submitted each semester for the following semester, through the Plan Change Form, there is always a due date. To change engineering programs, you must fill out a Plan Change Form. After you submit this form, your request will be reviewed and forwarded to enrolment services and student records for processing, if approved. Plan Change requests for the Fall 2022 semester are due by August 1, 2022.

responses:
Students can re-submit a Plan Change for the following semester to be re-considered.
Students may also want to meet with the First-Year Academic Services and Success Facilitator

patterns: What happens if I’m on Probation?
What is Probation?
What does it mean to be on probation?
Probation?
What if I have a CGPA of less than 1.67?
probationary contract
probation contract
responses: Students with an Academic Standing of Probationary are issued a Probationary Contract. The Probationary Contracts (which lists each student's assigned courses) are emailed to students invdividually from the firstyeareng@ryerson.ca email. Students with a Probationary Standing are required to attend a MANDATORY seminar. At the seminar, an academic advisor will provide complete instructions on how the student proceeds after seminar, along with information about any course restrictions. If students with a Probationary Contract would like to drop a course, they must meet request permission from an academic advisor for approval. Be aware of timelines and drop deadlines here when advising students. If an incomplete mark leaves a student on probation, they are to meet with an academic advisor and follow with the probationary contract issued until the grade is updated.

patterns: What is RAMSS?
What is RAMSS for?
What does RAMSS mean?
responses: RAMSS stands for Ryerson's Administrative Management Self Service. It is utilized by students to view their academic, financial and personal information at TMU.

patterns: RAMSS Fee Payment Issues
I have trouble paying my fees
I have trouble paying my fees on RAMSS
I have payment issues on RAMSS

How do I pay my fees?
responses: Please visit the ServiceHub for any questions regarding fees, as the First Year Engineering Office does not deal with finances. Try finding the answer to your question first at ask.ryerson.ca, and if you cannot find what you're looking for, fill out the ServiceHub help form.

patterns: When is reading week?
Do we have reading week?
Do engineering students have reading week?
Reading week?
responses: Engineering students DO NOT get a Fall Reading Week. However, engineering students do get a Winter Reading Week, which is from February 18, 2023 to February 24, 2023. More significant dates can be found on the Significant Dates Calendar.

patterns: What if I need consideration for religious obligations?
I have to miss something due to religious reasons. What do I do?
I need religious accommodation
Religious
I have to miss a class, lab, test, or exam due to religious reason
responses: Toronto Metropolitan provides accommodation for religious, aboriginal and spiritual obligations. Students are required to fill out the Toronto Metropolitan Religious Observance Form and submit it directly to their professors within the first 2 weeks of class; if the dates aren’t known in advance, students are required to provide as much notice as possible. Religious Observance requests can be made for exams but must be done within 2 weeks from the posting of the exam schedule.

patterns: What courses are required in first year?
What courses are required?
What are my required courses?
What are my required courses for first year?
What mandatory courses do I have to take?
What are the mandatory courses?
what courses do i need to take
how many courses do i take
responses: The first semester of engineering is a common semester. Every engineering student is automatically enrolled in CEN 100, CHY 102, MTH 140, MTH 141, PCS 211. In the second semester, students will begin branching off into some discipline specific courses with a few common courses. A list of these courses appears in the undergraduate calendar. Please take a look at common FAQ questions.

patterns: What happens if I’m Required to Withdraw?
What does it mean to be Required to Withdraw?
What is RTW
What is Reinstatement/ Fresh Start?
responses: Required to Withdraw(RTW) means that students will be required to withdraw from their program and TMU for 12 months. Students will be expected to attend a MANDATORY Required to Withdraw seminar where specific information will be presented to students regarding their next steps as an RTW student. Some of which include ways that students may improve their chances of being reinstated back into your program. If a student is Required to Withdraw, and their CGPA is at least 1.33 or higher, the student may be eligible for the Fresh Start Program after sitting out one semester. Pending approval, the student may pursue reinstatement or transfer to another program by taking two courses for credit in their first semester back and four courses in their second semester back.

patterns: Where can I opt out of the RSU Health and Dental coverage?
How do I opt out of the Health and Dental coverage
What will happen if I opt out of the RSU health and dental plan?
responses: Complete the opt-out form on the RSU website by October 1st. Refunds are applied to your student account in November. Please visit the Account Inquiry section of your Student Centre on RAMSS to confirm that the credit has been applied. Once you have successfully opted out of the RSU Members’ Health and Dental Plan, your opt out status will be carried forward in subsequent years, and you will not be assessed the RSU Members’ Health and Dental Plan fee.

patterns: What is the RSU health and dental plan?

responses: For information on fees, coverage and opting out, please visit the Ryerson Students’ Union website .

First Day of Fall Undergraduate Classes (Including Engineering) start September 6, 2022. Please refer to the school calendar for more information.

patterns: What technology should I have to be successful in my program?

What technology should I have?

responses: The Faculty of Engineering and Architectural Science (FEAS) Dean’s Office is working to ensure that you can access important engineering software remotely. We do recommend that you try to have access to a computer and wireless internet access. For those whose financial circumstances prevent them from having computers or wireless internet connections, we are working on a plan for a loan-out system. More information will be provided to you through the FEAS Dean’s Office, and on TMU COVID-19 Information and Updates.

patterns: Is the Test Centre still open?

test accommodations

responses:
Students with Accomodations should connect directly with their AAS facilitator for advising. 

AAS-registered students should still book their accommodated tests through the Online Student Accommodations Portal, so that instructors are notified of their test accommodations. Then, the instructor will be able to apply the appropriate accommodations within the online test platform. If you are needing to do a make-up for a missed obligation, please contact your professors as they will let you know how they plan on administering the make-up.

responses: Students should wait until they have received their course outlines and have attended their first week of classes before purchasing any textbooks or course materials. Course materials, merch and calculators can be purchased through the Ryerson Campus Store.

patterns: How do I apply for transfer credits?
Transfer credits
responses: A self-service application is available on RAMSS after activation of your Ryerson identity. However, some institutions outside of province or Canada require the Manual Application Upload. Before you apply, make sure to check your eligibility.

responses: To ensure the transfer credits are applied to a student's courses, they will need to drop the course that they recieved a transfer credit for, if  RAMSS automatically registered the student into that first year course.

patterns: How does the transition program work?
What courses are offered in the transition program?
What is the transition program?
Are engineering courses being offered both in Spring and in Summer?
How can I take engineering courses in the summer semester?
Are transition courses being offered?
transition courses
are engineering courses being offered in the spring or summer
responses: For first years, the Engineering Transition Program offers all 1st semester classes in the Fall and then again in the Winter semester (with the exception of CEN100) and all 2nd semester courses in the Winter and then again in the Spring (with the exception of ECN801). TMU does not offer engineering transition courses both in Spring and in Summer. First-year Engineering Transition Courses are generally offered in the Spring Speak to an academic advisor to help plan out your course load, and learn more about the Transition Program.

patterns: What is the Writing Skills Test
What is the WST?
what is wst
wst
responses: All first-year engineering students are required to complete and pass the Writing Skills Test (CEN 199). For more information, visit Writing Skills Test for Engineering Students.

patterns: When is the Writing Skills Test offered?
When is the Writing Skills test?
Writing Skills Test
When will the writing skills test take place?
When is the next WST?
responses: The next Writing Skills Test will be held on Monday, August 29, 2022 at 3 PM EST. This information will be shared with all students via email shortly. The test is held three times a year: end of August (during orientation), November, and late April/early May. If you miss one test date, you can write it at the next. Once the details are confirmed for each test (date, time, location), an email will be sent to all students. You must pass the WST before you can enter your third year. For recent updates about the WST, students can view details on the FYEO Website.

patterns: What if I didn’t pass the Writing Skills Test (WST)?
What if I don't pass the test
What happens if I don't pass the writing skills test?
What happens if I fail the writing skills test
responses: If you don't pass the WST, you will receive a grade of INP (in-progress) in CEN 199, and are encouraged to enroll in LNG 111, LNG 112, LNG 113, or LNG 121, depending on the outcome of the WST assessment. These are writing-intensive humanities and social science courses designed to give you the opportunity to strengthen your foundation in communication. They also count as lower-level liberal studies courses. If you don't pass your second attempt at the WST, or you just want to further develop your language and writing skills after completing the LNG courses, you may benefit from TMU's online and/or in-class preparatory English language courses offered through the G. Raymond Chang School of Continuing Education. Note: You may not proceed into the third year of your engineering program without passing the WST. But if you don't pass the test during orientation, you will have more chances to write and pass the test. A reminder that students are not encouraged to take the first Table A listed in the calendar in the first Fall or Winter semester.

patterns: Can I take a Liberal before doing the WST?
Can i take a Liberal before the writing skills test
responses: You can take a Liberal before completing the WST successfully. Keep in mind that Liberal courses will be writing heavy so if you didn't do well in the WST you may find the Liberal course challenging. We also encourage students to take a reduced course load in their first year, a Liberal course is one you may want to consider taking over the Spring Summer semesters. Need to complete WST before moving into the 3rd year of study. For more information and recent updates about the WST, please view the FYEO Website.
